reason: Immediate market decline and cautious derivative signals indicate short-term weakness. Significant overhead resistance at $88,500 is expected as over half of Bitcoin's invested supply has a cost basis above $88,000, likely leading to selling pressure on any rebound. While institutional buying interest (Metaplanet) and platform expansion (Bybit) provide long-term bullish undertones, they do not counteract the immediate market caution and potential for further consolidation or slight downside.
headlines: Crypto Markets Today: Largest tokens decline, with derivatives signaling caution ahead
Metaplanet is raising $137 million to pay down debt and buy even more bitcoin
Crypto payments firm BCB Group appoints Tim Renew as CEO in leadership reshuffle
More than half of bitcoin’s invested supply has a cost basis above $88,000
Bybit is adding bank accounts to its crypto platform with eye on U.S. expansion: Bloomberg
